name: After Dinner Mint
instructions: Shack vigorously and serve.

name: Alhambra
instructions: Make the cocoa in an irish coffee cup and add the cognac.

name: Alhambra Royale
instructions: Fill a mug with hot chocolate almost to the brim. Twist an orange peel over the mug and add it to the chocolate. Using a ladle, warm the cognac over hot water, ignite and while still flaming, pour into the mug. Garnish with whipped cream.

name: Apple Toddy
instructions: Place the baked apple, sugar and applejack into a glass or mug. Fill the glass two-thirds full with boiling water, and grate a little nutmeg on top.

name: Blue Blazer #2
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a saucepan and heat until the honey has completely dissolved. Pour in Old-fashioned glasses with a spoon in it (to prevent the glass from breaking if the drink is too hot).

name: Brandy Toddy
instructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in 1 tsp. water in an old-fashioned glass. Add brandy and one ice cube and stir. Add twist of lemon peel on top and serve.

name: Bumpo
instructions: Add to heatproof cup and allow the sugar to dissolve. Dust with nutmeg.

name: Canadian Cocoa
instructions: Heat milk in a small saucepan. When simmering, add remaining ingredients. Allow syrup to dissolve, and pour into a heat-proof glass.

name: Chai Toddy
instructions: Stir all ingredients in a mug and serve steaming hot. Garnish with a peppermint stick.

name: Chocolate Shock
instructions: Pour aftershock into a heatproof cup with hot chocolate, and serve.

name: Danish Toddy
instructions: Pour into a heat-proof cup and serve immediately.

name: Dot's Hot Spot
instructions: Heat gently in a small saucepan, strain into a heat-proof cup, and serve.

name: Dreamy Chocolate Winter
instructions: Pour kahlua and irish cream into a heatproof cup with hot chocolate. Add amaretto, to taste. Stir, and serve.

name: Dreamy Winter
instructions: Pour hot chocolate into a heatproof cup. Add irish cream, to taste. Stir, and serve.

name: Dreamy Winter Delight
instructions: Pour irish cream into a heatproof cup with hot chocolate. Add amaretto, to taste. Stir, and serve.

name: Dreamy Winter Night
instructions: Pour hot chocolate into a heatproof cup. Add amaretto, to taste. Stir, and serve.

name: Dressed Up Like A Dogs Dinner
instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Dressed Up Pina Colada
instructions: Make a zig-zag pattern of chocolate syrup on the inside of the glass while turning the glass. Blend rum, coconut milk and pineapple, with 2 cups of crushed ice, on high for a few seconds, until all large chunks of ice are gone. Pour into glass. Top with whipped cream and a cherry.

ingredients.name: Captain Morgan® Parrot Bay coconut rum

name: Galliano Toddy
instructions: Pour into a hot cup, sprinkle with grated nutmeg, and serve.

name: Gin Toddy
instructions: Mix powdered sugar and water in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and one ice cube. Stir, add the twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Goldie
instructions: Heat in a heat-resistant glass, add orange peel, and serve.

name: Hot Frenchman
instructions: Heat well in a heat-resistant glass or cup. Stir, add twists of lemon and orange peel, and serve.

name: Hot Gin
instructions: Pour into a heat-proof goblet, and serve.

name: Hot Irish
instructions: Pour into a heat-proof goblet, sweeten with brown sugar (to taste), and serve.

name: Hot Jamaican
instructions: Heat gently in a saucepan, pour unstrained into a heat-proof goblet, and serve.

name: Hot M.M.M.
instructions: Heat in a heat-resistant glass or cup. Add twists of orange and lemon peel, and serve.

name: Hot Scotch
instructions: Pour butterscotch schnapps (buttershots) into an 8 oz. mug and fill with hot chocolate. Garnish with whipped cream.

name: Hot Scotch Nightcap
instructions: Pour into a heat-proof cup, and serve.

name: Hot Whiskey
instructions: Pour the whiskey into a whiskey sour glass. Add cloves into the fresh lemon and place into the whiskey. Fill with hot water and dissolve in the sugar. Serve immediately.

name: Jean Gabin
instructions: Heat rum, calvados and syrup in a heat-resistant glass or cup. Fill with hot milk, sprinkle with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Negus
instructions: Heat ingredients (with lemon thinly sliced into rings, and a heaped teaspoon of sugar). Strain into a heat-proof goblet when hot.

name: Red Mouth
instructions: Heat in a heat-resistant glass or cup.

name: Red Rudolph
instructions: Heat and pour into an irish coffee cup. Top with whipped cream, garnish with a tall cinnamon stick, and serve.

name: Rock-and-Rye Toddy
instructions: Pour rock and rye and bitters into a coffee mug. Add lemon slice, boiling water and cinnamon stick. Stir, sprinkle with grated nutmeg, and serve.

name: Rum Toddy
instructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in water in an old-fashioned glass. Add rum, one ice cube, and stir. Add a twist of lemon peel and serve.

name: Sweet and Hot
instructions: Heat in a heat-resistant glass, add a twist of lemon peel and a clove, and serve.

name: Vruica Rakia
instructions: Heat in a small saucepan, dissolving sugar. Serve in a heat-proof cup when hot.

name: Whiskey Hot Toddy
instructions: Heat in a heat-resistant glass, and fill with hot water. Add a lemon slice speared with a clove, and serve.
